_header: In the first week of the season of May
Note:
For French original cf. Le Debat du cueur et de l’oeil, in London, British Library Royal 19 A.III, ff. 29-41v; and Le Jardin de Plaisance, c. 1501; facs. #SATF; and cf. Wright (1841)
XWright, Thomas. The Latin Poems Commonly Attributed to Walter Mapes.
Camden Society o.s. 16 (1841), 310.
Title(s): ’A Lytel Treatyse called the Dysputacyon or Complaynt of the Heart thorughe perced with the Lokynge of the Eye’
_description: ’A Lytel Treatyse called the Dysputacyon or Complaynt of the Heart thorughe perced with the Lokynge of the Eye’ — 103 eight-line stanzas (ababbcbc)

Longleat258.First Lines:
[I]n the first weke of the sason of MayWhan the wodes be couered al
                    in grene…
Longleat258.Last Lines:
…Shal gete than to loue for him I prayThat to al his desires
                    he may attayne
Longleat258.Editions:
Hammond,  Eleanor Prescott. 
             “The Eye and the Heart.” 
             Anglia
         34 (1911): 235-65: 237-65.
